title: Troubleshooting Email Client Connection Issues
subtitle: Resolving common problems with Outlook, Thunderbird, and webmail access.

sections.title: Overview
content: This article provides step-by-step instructions to diagnose and resolve common email client connection problems, including issues with sending, receiving, or accessing email through desktop applications like Microsoft Outlook or Mozilla Thunderbird, and web-based email services.

list.description: Email client displays "Disconnected" or "Needs Password" message.
Unable to send or receive emails.
Error messages like "Server not found," "Connection timed out," or "Authentication failed."
Webmail access issues (e.g., unable to log in, page not loading).

sections.title: Cause
content: Email connection issues can stem from various sources, including incorrect account settings, network connectivity problems, firewall/antivirus interference, or server-side outages. This guide will help you systematically check for these common causes.

alert.title: Before You Begin
alert.content: Ensure your computer is connected to the internet and try accessing a website (e.g., google.com) to confirm basic network connectivity.

list.title: Check Internet Connection:
list.description: Verify your device has an active internet connection. Try opening a web browser and navigating to a known website like https://www.google.com. If you cannot access websites, troubleshoot your network connection first.

list.title: Verify Email Account Settings:
list.description: Incorrect server settings (IMAP/POP3, SMTP), port numbers, or encryption methods are common culprits. Refer to your email provider's documentation for the correct settings. For corporate email, contact your IT department.

list.title: Check Password:
list.description: Confirm you are using the correct password. If you recently changed your email password, update it in your email client settings. Try logging into your webmail directly to rule out a password issue.

list.title: Disable Firewall/Antivirus Temporarily:
list.description: Security software can sometimes block email client connections. Temporarily disable your firewall or antivirus software and try connecting. If this resolves the issue, configure your security software to allow your email client.

list.title: Restart Email Client and Computer:
list.description: A simple restart can often resolve temporary glitches. Close your email client completely and reopen it. If the issue persists, restart your computer.

list.title: Repair/Recreate Email Profile (Outlook Specific):
list.description: For Microsoft Outlook, a corrupted mail profile can cause connection issues. You can try repairing your existing profile or creating a new one via the Mail Setup (Outlook) in Control Panel.

alert.title: Important Note
alert.content: Temporarily disabling security software should only be done for testing purposes. Re-enable it immediately after testing to protect your system.
